values:
It has been a really long time since I have updated...so last night I had the brilliant idea of doing so.  Unfortunately somebody did not not want me to update my journal.  Hence the lights went out and it was dark.  I was very upset because all the things that I wanted to do last night required a dose of light...and that was not available to me.  So I did the only thing that I could do in my room in the dark at 10:30 at night...I WENT TO SLEEP...I was woken up at about midnight (or whenever the lights went back on) and that was a good thing...I got to set my alarm clock!

On another note I am extremely excited about this weekend...I get to go skiing (ever since I got to college I just don't get to ski as much as I used to)...And I get to see two thirds of my immediate family.

On some other note...I am not looking foward to my three hour class that is taking place at 6:45 tonight...but on the bright side at least it's only once a week.

it turns out that i really don't have much to say...so i will stop this journal entry for now and do something else...anyway have a nice day.  goodbye!
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/3115.html

Dear one and all:

Happy Holidays to you and now back to ME!!!

I was told before I left school that I have to just sit down and write this entry already...there are reasons why an entry has not been posted in, well, forever.  I started writing this entry a few other times...most of the time I didn't like how it was turning out (so I trashed it, over and over again).  A few times I ran out of time when trying to write my entry and well that is why it has not been posted until this current time.

The studio final was a week and a half of quite literal HELL...yes it was go to studio, eat, go to classes, some more studio, sleep for 3-4.5 hours a night, shower, Saturday morning at 12:30 cut your finger (that is my finger), go to hospital until five to get stitches in...etc. etc.  This hell had no interuptions...nothing fun happened during that time and HELL was there...ALL THE TIME.  I hate that type of repetitiveness...it has got to drive a person insane (good thing I was not sane when I started the project).

Christmas is tomorrow...and what does that mean?  Yes it means gifts for ME...the good little JEW (what the F***!!!???).  I can't wait!!!  Although I basically picked out everything I am getting...I won't be suprised...but that doesn't mean I won't be happy about getting the gifts.

The last matter of business is the dedication of this journal entry...and since Re has stated that I have not dedicated any to her...I did tell her that none of the randomness that I have ever written was about her that it wouldn't be logical...but now here comes a time when I can dedicate this entry to her...the reasons being that she is the one who told me to buckle myself down and just write the entry...secondly she was one fifth of the people during the studio final hell that kept me entertained (for example when she said "Oh my balls" instead of "Oh balls")...thirdly I was at a loss of who else to dedicate my entry to...So for the record Re have a merry Christmas and I hope your exams went real well...and that your family is well...oh and that you get all of the great gifts that you wanted!!!

On that note I would actually like everybodies families to be awesome...for everybody to have done well on exams, for everybody to get what they want for Christmas  and lastly I would love for everybody to have an awesome holiday...-Jill
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/2860.html

So I woke up this morning at 4 am...I am rolled up in a ball shivering...I then realize that my top sheet, my blanket and my fleecy blanket are not on me...wait a minute they are not on my bed either...I get up to search for them...they are sitting in a ball on my chair at my desk...I really really really wonder how they got there...who knows?
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/2813.html

The Unbirthday Song
MARCH HARE:
A very merry unbirthday to me

MAD HATTER:
To who?

MARCH HARE:
To me

MAD HATTER:
Oh you!

MARCH HARE:
A very merry unbirthday to you

MAD HATTER:
Who me?

MARCH HARE:
Yes, you!

MAD HATTER:
Oh, me!

MARCH HARE:
Let's all congratulate us with another cup of tea
A very merry unbirthday to you!

[DIALOGUE]

MAD HATTER:
Now, statistics prove, prove that you've one birthday

MARCH HARE:
Imagine, just one birthday every year

MAD HATTER:
Ah, but there are three hundred and sixty four unbirthdays!

MARCH HARE:
Precisely why we're gathered here to cheer

[DIALOGUE]

BOTH:
A very merry unbirthday to you, to you

ALICE:
To me?

MAD HATTER:
To you!

BOTH:
A very merry unbirthday

ALICE:
For me?

MARCH HARE:
For you!

MAD HATTER:
Now blow the candle out my dear
And make your wish come true

BOTH:
A merry merry unbirthday to you!

It was recently (last night recent) decided that Corinne and I need a pet for our apartment for next year.  The animal that we both agreed on is a domesticated SKUNK.  The only problem with having a domesticated skunk is... well there are more then just one thing!

1) they carry rabies and well nobody would be able to walk into our apartment without getting a shot first.  Yeah I think people would enjoy coming over and they ring the door bell and we come to the door with a needle in our hand and say "bend over".

2) they need a lot of attention and neither Corinne nor I have that type of time.

3) I don't know what the laws are in RI for keeping a skunk as a pet.

4) Is there a docter near by to take care of Pepe when Pepe is taken ill?

yeah so i still want one...a baby one...but those are the listed problems that come hand in hand with owning a skunk...

oh by the way you can never hit a skunk...they will remember and kick your ass!

this entry is dedicated to the evil raccoon that made Corinne and I want to have a pet next year!

P.S. beware of the evil raccoon he lurks everywhere.
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/1522.html

SO CORINNE AND I ARE ON A MISSION (IT IS TOP SECRET SO I CAN'T TELL YOU OF THE PARTICULARS INVOLVED) AND THEN WHEN OUR MISSION FAILED (WE COULDN'T FIND WHAT WE SENT OURSELVES OUT TO LOOK FOR) WE DECIDED TO SKIP DINNER AND JUST GO TO THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY FOR DESSERT.  ON OUR WAY TO PROVIDENCE ON 195 THE LANES CONVERGE AND I PERSONALLY HATE THE PEOPLE WHO WAIT FOR THE LAST MINUTE TO GET OVER AND THINK THAT THEY CAN JUST CUT IN FRONT OF YOU.  SO I DIDN'T LET THE PERSON IN.  CORINNE AND I WERE CONVINCED THAT IT WAS A WOMAN AND WERE LIKE "SHE'S A RUDE WOMAN!"  SO THE PERSON GETS IN BEHIND US AND THEN MOVES TO THE LANE ON OUR RIGHT.  THE DRIVER PULLS NEXT TO US ROLLS DOWN THEIR WINDOW GIVES US THE FINGER AND YELLS "FUCK YOU"...MEANWHILE THE ONLY THING THAT CORINNE AND I CAN SAY IS "THAT WAS A GUY?"  THIS GUY WAS DRIVING LIKE THE MOST WOMENLY CAR EVER...WE JUST COULDN'T BELIEVE IT.  WE WERE LOOKING FOR HIM THE WHOLE REST OF THE WAY TO PROVIDENCE...I REALLY DO NEED THE PRACTICE ON MY ROAD RAGE.

i still can't believe that naylor left her utrecht shetckbook in utrecht...and she wouldn't even call to see if they had it! hahaha!!!

who should i dedicate this journal to?  ok i will dedicate this journal entry to corinne cause of the jokes that we made about the woman (i mean man) that we encountered on our way to providence to get a huge, big ass desert.

p.s. i just can't wait for our site and environment trip on sunday!!!

oh and corinne and i saw professor butler at stop and shop!
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/1069.html

I know that some people might think that when I talk about apples that I am refering ones that are green and in liquid form...well this time I am not!

I just wanted to say that I love McIntosh apples!

and since Emma* gave me a McIntosh apple on Monday this entry is dedicated to her.

 

*Emma is a professional apple picker from the far reaches of... Maine.
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/930.html

So apparently all you need to do to get me to do something is just dare me!  Recently (like two and a half hours ago) I was dared to bunny hop back to my studio desk...and I did (and all I got for it was a fireball that I gave to Haruko)!

I would like to learn morsecode so that I can morsecode coded messages to people...actually only to other people who happen to know how to morsecode it up.  I want to just go like:  taptaptap...taptap...taptaptaptap...tap...and have it mean something!

COOL ARTSY PERSON OF THE DAY:  Savin Couelle...he's like the master stair man...so check him out!

I would just like to inform the masses that I MUST go to Brit's soccer game on Tuesday the fifth so if anyone would like to join me in being a number twenty-two supporter please feel free to come.

I dedicate this edition of "my name is jill" live journal to the B.f.B club.

<SNAP crackle and POP>

Oh so by the way is our S&E field trip on the Sat. or Sun.?  Please let me know!!!

And my final and last random remark of the night is... I want to go to the TENNIS HALL OF FAME in Newport so that I can play on their courts and pretend that I am in the finals at Wimbledon (I can totally kick Kirsten Dunst's ass)... I have never played on grass courts but it would be fun to try!

Laters...this is me signing off!@#$%^&*()_+
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/517.html

This is the very first entry of my live journal. So I will tell you a little about...something! I hate smiley faces...so you won't be seeing them on my page. I call inatement objects by the name of COLIN. I am a neurotic person who wakes up at 9:00 AM every Saturday morning to do laundry before other people get up and decide to clean their dirty clothes. I do not like a particular architecture professor that goes by the name FORGET (and that is not pronounced like forget). I like to read books...but mostly that urge comes when I have like all nighters in studio coming my way. I want to learn how to fence...I want to go rifle shooting and archery shooting again. I'm really not that bad with aim...I know most people would want to be about a million miles away from me if I actually had anything other than a toy gun in my hand. I have named myself the official architect for the short people (people under five feet). I am a sarcastic person who will try to cheer people up by making them laugh (is there any other way?). I...I...I don't know what else is interesting to talk about right now...oh by the way September 22nd is officially named ALTERNATOR DAY.
http://my-name-is-jill.livejournal.com/329.html
